pages.text: To build and operate a $(item)Pit Kiln$() you will need a $(item)Pit Kiln$(), four $(item)Straw$(), a $(item)Straw Bale$(), three $(thing)Logs$(), and a $(l:appendix/ignition)verified fire-starting device$().$(p)Two clumps of $(item)Dried Plant Fibers$() can be tied together to make $(item)Straw$().
$(info) $(item)Straw$() can also be created by drying $(item)Wheat$().

To use a $(item)Pit Kiln$(), follow these steps:$(p)  $(l:adapt/pit_kiln#step_1)1. Place Kiln$(/l)$(br)  $(l:adapt/pit_kiln#step_2)2. Add Ingredients$(/l)$(br)  $(l:adapt/pit_kiln#step_3)3. Add Straw Bale$(/l)$(br)  $(l:adapt/pit_kiln#step_4)4. Add Logs$(/l)$(br)  $(l:adapt/pit_kiln#step_5)5. Ignite$(/l)$(br)  $(l:adapt/pit_kiln#step_6)6. Wait$(/l)$(p)The facing page illustrates the construction of a $(item)Pit Kiln$() and the subsequent pages provide additional vital and fundamental details.

First, dig a pit in the ground and place your $(item)Pit Kiln$() at the bottom.$(p)$(info) A $(item)Pit Kiln$() must be covered at all times on the bottom and all four sides by solid, non-flammable material; the top is left exposed.

Next, add your ingredient(s) to the top of the $(item)Pit Kiln$().$(p)$(info) A $(item)Pit Kiln$() can only hold one type of item.$(p)$(warning) Please note that in the illustrations for step two, three, and four, two $(item)Grass Blocks$() on the sides of the $(item)Pit Kiln$() have been removed - they are removed in the illustration for clarity and are still required.
Next, use any $(l:appendix/ignition)verified fire-starting device$() to ignite.$(p)$(info) Unlike a $(thing)Pit Burn$(), the $(item)Pit Kiln$() is left uncovered on top while it burns.
Finally, wait.$(p)$(info) While a $(item)Pit Kiln$() is active, it will remain on fire.$(p)$(warning) If a $(item)Pit Kiln$() is exposed to rain during its operation, the process will fail.

When the fire on top of the $(item)Pit Kiln$() finally goes out, sift through the ash for the results.$(p)$(warning) Due to the crude nature of the $(item)Pit Kiln$(), there is a chance that items will fail to fire and instead produce a failed result.
